stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Mitm
[Gender] Male
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Kazdel
[Date of Birth] Sep 19
[Race] Sarkaz
[Height] 165cm
[Infection Status]
Confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Standard
[Mobility] Normal
[Physical Resilience] Normal
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Pohl was known as 'Consultant' amongst the citizens of Kazdel, and is an important figure in maintaining order on the streets. He joined Rhodes Island by the recommendation of Operator Nymph, and assists Rhodes Island's intelligence and communication operations in Kazdel under the code name Mitm.

Imaging tests show the indistinct outlines of internal organs, obscured by abnormal shadows. Originium granules detected in the circulatory system. The subject is confirmed to be infected with Oripathy.

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 8%
No visible Originium crystals have been observed on the surface of Mitm's body, but continued monitoring is required.

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.18u/L
The growth rate of BOCD shows signs of slowing down. After leaving the high-Originium environment of Kazdel, it is expected that the condition will be better controlled.
Examination of epidermis samples taken from the subject's chest tattoo revealed the presence of Originium in the dye used. He says he was unaware of this. The Medical Department has prepared a special ointment for external application.

'My name's Pohl. No, it doesn't have any special meaning. Sarkaz like me, our parents don't really think too hard about the names they give us. I was born and raised in Kazdel. Spent most of my time as a street peacekeeper. They call me 'Consultant', but I don't get paid for the job. I didn't know much about Rhodes Island, but Nymph and Mudrock said it's a nice place. In terms of pay and benefits, I mean. Can't stay on the ship for too long, though, or all hell will break loose back home. Plus, I've gotta be your eyes and ears there, don't I? That's what you pay me for. Well, that's pretty much it. I've never written a 'personal statement', and I don't know how.'

[Classified Log]
Operator Mitm's personal statement shows that he continues to be guarded towards Rhodes Island.
Information from other sources in Kazdel indicates that he has never met his birth parents. The origin of the name 'Pohl' is unknown, but it has been seen etched into one of his daggers. The blade, which originated from Columbia, is of low quality, the only advantage being the low cost.
Pohl began monitoring any faction that has any dealings in Kazdel very early in his 'Consultant' career, including, of course, Rhodes Island.
He receives regular reports on comings and goings from the smugglers that roam the lands outside Kazdel, and any new faces are shadowed by orphans within the city, who also report to him. The information network he has built far exceeds the scope of his role as so-called 'street peacekeeper'.
We should perhaps reassess the motives of this slum 'Consultant' in joining Rhodes Island, and the potential risks of allowing him access to confidential data.

No need to blow things out of proportion. I've heard about him from Nymph. He's just a kid who's had some hard luck. Leave him alone.
—■■■

[Special Supplies Request - Pending]
Applicant: Mitm
Status: Pending
Reviewer: Logistics Department
Application: I found some discarded newspapers in the living area trash bin. I'll take them if nobody wants them.

[Special Supplies Request - Rejected]
Applicant: Mitm
Status: Rejected
Reviewer: Logistics Department
Response: Operator Mitm, garbage is collected and processed by specialized personnel. For hygiene reasons, please observe the Living Area Hygiene Convention and refrain from picking discarded newspapers from the trash bins. You may access newspapers in the reading room, or fill in a newspaper subscription application at the Logistics Department office.

[Special Supplies Request - Pending]
Applicant: Mitm
Status: Pending
Reviewer: Logistics Department
Application: Oh it's nothing, just wanted to let you know that I've taken those old newspapers. They're really clean and there are papers from everywhere. I want to figure out how these things are made, and then I'll start one in Kazdel myself ;)

The day after Operator Mitm was reprimanded for violating the Living Area Hygiene Convention, he was given a blank newspaper subscription application that listed all the newspapers that Procurement is able to supply. Rather than immediately fill it out, he studied the newspapers he had scavenged and came to a disappointing conclusion: Starting a newspaper is about more than just writing. It requires a large amount of paper, ink, and printing machinery, not to mention the manpower required to deliver the newspaper to households. Kazdel was not just missing a newspaper, it was missing the infrastructure to support one.

'I used to think that the people of Kazdel needed a newspaper so that they'd know what's happening inside and outside the city, making it easier for them to go about their day. But now, I realize that newspapers are just a vehicle, and it's not the only way to pass on information.'
'What are you planning?'
'I'm gonna set up loudspeakers by each furnace node, and broadcast the news I learned to nearby residents. Still hammering out the details.'
'Sounds like a good idea. You can request the necessary items from Logistics and Procurement. I guess I'll take this subscription application form back...'
'Hey, not so fast! I'm filling it out. Two copies of each one, one for learning how to write news, and one for teaching the kids in Kazdel how to read. That's not against the rules, is it?'
'No, but do you have enough room in your suitcase for all those newspapers?'
'Worst case, I take less clothes and a few more suitcases. Not a problem.'

Cherry-3, often believed to be an imitation of a popular Columbian remote recon car, was in fact invented by Mitm after joining Rhodes Island. He can only claim credit for the original idea, however. The actual blueprint, as well as the custom parts used, was mostly the work of others.

I was taking a break in the Engineering's kitchen that day after spraining my ankle. Operator Mitm came in and said he had a golden opportunity to get rich. When no one paid attention to him, he said he had a cutting-edge research project. Still, no one paid attention to him. Finally, he sighed and said, 'I guess Engineering's all about theory and not practical tech. Guess I'll ask Logistics instead.' That got everybody's attention. I didn't really listen to what he was saying, but the gist was that he wanted a remote car that can fight, but all he had was a hundred LMD and some scrap metal. Everybody turned around and left, and I was the only one left in the kitchen... You're wondering why I stayed? Like I said, I sprained my ankle. He thought I was up for it, and so he grabbed my hand and thanked me profusely, talking about being 'pioneers' and 'industry-leading'. Well, I guess I fell for it. By the time I realized it, it was too late. I'd already said yes.
—Interview log with Operator Humus, Engineering Department, joint inventor of Cherry-3

Despite a rocky start, Mitm and Humus were able to build a prototype. Though Mayer's connections, they sold the rights of the Cherry Recon Car to a Columbian businessman at a handsome price.
Surprisingly, Mitm handed the proceeds over to Humus, saying that he only supplied the idea, and that it was Humus who did most of the work. Humus gladly accepted the funds, which allowed him to finally begin the development of his 'automatic eating machine'.

Let me reiterate that Cherry-3 is not related to the Columbian Cherry Recon Car in any way, nor is there any concern over intellectual property infringement whatsoever. First, their names are different. Second, Cherry-3 was designed for educational purposes; all of its functions have been designed with education in mind. You are aware, of course, that the environment in Kazdel is not at all friendly to kids who wish to study uninterrupted. Which is why the machine's been fitted with early-warning, deterrence, and limited self-defense systems. The all-terrain tires and solar panels provide it with the necessary mobility and endurance. Oh, this button? That's the self-destruct button. You are aware, of course, that the environment in Kazdel... ahem. Anyway, I've no intention of putting it out to market at this time, so our colleagues in the industry need not worry.
—Interview log with Operator Mitm, joint inventor of Cherry-3

As Mitm's onboarding HR operator observed, Mitm remained on guard about Rhodes Island for a considerable period of time.
Therefore, when a group of Sarkaz children came to him to ask about the current situation in Kazdel, he thought it was a move by HR to investigate his background.
Witnesses reported that he threw a handful of rough sugar lumps at them and turned to leave, only for the children to pick up the sugar, return it to him, and tell him that he should not waste food. That encouraged him to sit down and talk to them.
Most of these children were born in Kazdel, and some of their parents are still assisting with the city's rebuilding project. They had heard from Operator Odda that the famous 'Consultant' of Kazdel had come to Rhodes Island, and came to hear his stories between treatment sessions.
Mitm did not let his guard down, and embellished his stories with outlandish episodes in an attempt to interfere with the nonexistent 'investigator'. He soon realized, however, that the children eagerly took in even his most absurd stories.
They covered their ears in fear when he talked about how he escaped a mass grave by digging a hole with a knife; cheered when he talked about how he scared away bandits who were looking to plunder food; and wept when he talked about how he led emergency repairs for a collapsed furnace node, never letting go even when it burned the skin off his arms and chest. When a teary child brought him a jar of burn ointment the next day, Mitm decided to stop deceiving them.
He told them another story, of a Sarkaz orphan who learned to lie, learned to protect himself with a knife, and somehow became someone that people listened to without really meaning to. Even with all the respect, however, whenever he went to bed at night he dreamt of the walls collapsing and everyone berating him with tears in their eyes. He thought the children would be bored, but when he looked up, there were the same eager eyes as ever, waiting for him to continue.
It is hard to say when Operator Mitm truly let his guard down, but it must have been after he told that story.

Later, Mitm asked Odda why the latter sent the kids to him. According to Odda, his answer was—
'Because you're a kid, too.'
Mitm denies that this conversation ever happened.

The name 'Consultant' is worth a day's worth of food in Kazdel. For Sarkaz in trouble, owing 'Consultant' a debt is often preferable to the alternative, which usually ends with somebody getting stabbed. Only Pohl knows how many names are on the Consultant's ledger, and it is one of the reasons why otherwise desperate outlaws still think twice about getting on his bad side: A single entry is worth somebody's life.
Pohl has set aside the Consultant's rules at Rhodes Island, where he has taken up the code name 'Mitm'. Here, he is the one who is uneasy about owing someone. Logistics operators in the cafeteria put on a little more gravy when they see the scars on his hands. Busy technicians set their work aside to help him clear spurious warnings from his terminal. And when he stands in bewilderment before the myriad goods on the procurement center shelves, a passing operator might recommend Mama John's vinegar-pickled cherry candy to him.
At first, Mitm thought he was somehow showing weakness that he should not, but after making adjustments to his tone of voice, his expression, and even the way he talked, he came to the conclusion that helping others came naturally to the people here.
On the eve of his return to Kazdel, Pohl cooked a pot of Sarkaz soup for the operators who had helped him.

'You're one heck of a cook, Mitm! I haven't had fin soup this good in ages. Do people in Kazdel use fresh fins to cook soup too?'
'Hah, no, fins are hard enough to come by in Kazdel, no one would waste them in soup.' Mitm scoops out a ladle-full of beans, mushroom and dried vegetables, and puts it into the operator's bowl.
'These vegetables can make a soup that tastes like fin broth, and it's just as hearty as the real thing. Even better with fresh vegetables instead of dried ones. Want another bowl?'

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

skills.desc: Instantly gains <@ba.vup>{cost}</> DP and causes Cherry-3 to self-destruct, dealing <@ba.vup>{aoe_damage_scale:0%}</> of Mitm's ATK as Physical damage to enemies in the four adjacent tiles

Gradually gains <@ba.vup>{mitm_s_2[cost].display}</> DP over the skill duration, ATK <@ba.vup>+{atk:0%}</>; Cherry-3 <@ba.vdown>stops attacking</>, gains Block <@ba.vup>+{block_cnt_display}</> and DEF <@ba.vup>+{mitm_s_2[to_token].def:0%}</>
<@ba.rem>After the skill ends, Cherry-3 will self-destruct</>

modules.desc:
Operator Mitm has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude in the designation of tactical points for summoning reinforcements so as to secure leeway for deployment.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Vanguard Operator during field operations to exercise Tactician responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

'With all that, are you sure you have enough vouchers to pay for it?' An operator selecting daily necessities cannot help but worry as they look at Mitm's bulging shopping bag.
'I've got a few coupons about to expire, so I need to use them up,' Mitm says, pushing an overflowing shopping cart from behind the shelf.
'Whoa! Look at all that stuff! I'd better check out now—I don't want to be stuck behind you in line.'
By the time Mitm reaches the checkout counter, a crowd had already gathered there, waiting for the show.
The logistics operator at the register looked fully prepared. 'Bring it on!' they cry.
The scanner beeps nonstop, as the total amount on screen keeps zooming skyward.
'Your total is... 997.5 LMD!'
'Hold on a second...' Mitm says as he reaches into the inner pocket of his coat.
'Planning to pay with your personal operator points? The 5% discount has already been applied.'
The crowd offers scattered applause, though the logistics operator shows no sign of relief. He knows the battle has only just begun.
'Is that so...' Mitm pulls out a large stack of vouchers, all in different colors, from his coat. 'I'd like to use these coupons too, please.'
The onlookers begin to murmur with excitement.
'Limited-time anniversary commemorative discount vouchers, new operator breakfast vouchers... these ones have expired.' The logistics operator carefully sorts through the stack and pulls out the few invalid ones.
The scanner beeps again, but this time, the number on the screen begins to drop steadily.
Fifteen minutes later, it displays '103 LMD.' The logistics operator finally smiles. 'Still above 100 LMD. Ha.'
Mitm frowns, scans the area, then fixes his gaze on the clock across from him.
'Add this.' Mitm picks up a pack of gum and hands it to the logistics operator. 'Also, it's just past 8 PM—after 8, fruit and deli are half-price.'
The logistics operator's smile freezes. The number on the display flickers, settling at 84.75.
The crowd erupts into cheers.
'Wait!' The logistics operator isn't ready to give up yet. He eyes the shopping bag hanging from Mitm's tail. 'What about that big bag? I haven't scanned anything in it yet!'
Mitm's expression changes. 'These are personal items!'
'No, I saw what's in it! A big box of cystymilk and some detergent... that's at least 30 LMD—I haven't lost yet!'
The logistics operator lunges forward, while Mitm swings his tail, sending the shopping bag flying.
The box of cystymilk spins in the air, the hinge on its side flipping open to reveal hidden blades; the detergent bottle opens wide, revealing a remote-controlled car and an energy reserve unit inside.
For a moment, a torrent of blades and metal tools flies everywhere...
'I told you, they're my personal items!'
'Who would hide dangerous items in milk cartons and detergent bottles?! Can't you use a normal toolbox like everyone else?'
'It's called 'camouflage'! If I carried a toolbox, even a kid would know there's a weapon inside.'

voice_lines.voiceText: Whaa? More work? But I came to Rhodes Island for a good holiday... Alright, if it's simply sorting files, I'm OK with that, I guess. But tell me, Doctor, what's my per diem?

The report you wanted's on your desk. Yeah, just one page. Not like we get something new in Kazdel every day. I mean C'mon, What else do you wanna know? How to pick the gate of the Temple of Knowledge? Cut me some slack, will ya? I'm just a slum snitch. Oh, right, you people here prefer intelligence agent.

Our rules are different from the ones you have at Rhodes Island. Also, they're not spelled out in black and white. Cuz' paper's pricey, and only a few can read. Plus each neighbourhood's got their own rules, so no one outside those blocks calls me 'consultant'. You can if you want, just don't expect me to get all tangled up in your mess.

The bandages on my digits? Just for style. Funny story, a few days ago I taught a bunch of nitpicking punks a lesson at the market. A vendor saw these bandages and thought I got hurt in the scuffle, so he gave me a few more green onions as a thank-you gift. Hmm? There's blood seeping out? No worries, that's just beetroot juice.

We call brown bread 'soft brick' and coats 'plaster'… What about sausages? What about 'em? Just sausages. Why? I mean, why give something you only get to eat once every few years a moniker? There's not much to the Kazdelian street slang, really. Just hang around a local construction site and you'll learn everything you need to know.

With how crowded Rhodes Island is, I'm surprised you don't have full-on fights on your hands. In Kazdel, people trade blows over just about anything, like if a valve should be turned once or twice. Sounds stupid, right? But when I tried to calm them down, I had to defuse a fight with dozens of pitchforks and shovels in my face. By the time I did, my legs were so wobbly I could barely walk home.

Want a candy? I always bring a few when I go out in case I run into street brats. When they block you for stuff, just throw one out, and they'll try to beat up the kid who grabbed it, leaving me alone to go on my merry way. Is this strategy talk? Nah, just sharing an anecdote is all.

Yo, you still need those coupons? Let me have 'em if you're gonna throw them out, I'm so close to getting a free BBQ. Nope, I read the rules, what they say is 'Only one coupon per purchase'. So it's fine if I settle the bill after each free dish... Tell you what, I also have a 50% off coupon for two, so if you don't tell Closure my plan, I'll take you for some roast beast tonight.

Seems like there's more budget for next season's operation? I'm not a real intelligence dealer, but I agree with one of their rules: Valuable info for valuable clients. I never waste your time with worthless trivia, and it's not just on account of your good prices.
Keep up the good work, Doctor. I need a nap.

Hey, wassup, here's my recommendation letter, HR already checked it. Wrong one? Give me a sec… uh, no… no… Oh, coupon... Ah, here it is. Sorry about that. Too many pockets on this plaster, hard to keep track of where I keep my things.
Way more entertaining than watching random street fights.
Your recognition is worth more than this medal, Doctor. By the by, is this pure gold? Kinda hard, to the bite.

Seems to me I've really sold my soul to Rhodes Island, but I'm sure you wouldn't want me to throw my life away so easily. If you ask me, we should live life to the fullest until we finish off everything we've gotta do.
No… My sweet, sweet vacation… But seriously though, I got you. When have I ever dropped the ball before?
Now, ain't these big shoes to fill? Stay sharp everyone, and give me your a hundred and ten percent.
Here's the battle plan, if you got any questions... Figure them out yourself.
Don't warn 'em, just hit 'em. Don't give them a chance to react.
Alright, let's go.
My turn now?
What a mess, but the view's perfect.
Oww… this is tricky, gonna cost you more. How about double the pay?
I don't owe you an explanation.
Still feel like yapping?
Oh I'm sorry, now you wanna surrender?
Seeing stars now are we? Sounds about right.
Man, that stuff was hairy. If all our missions are gonna be that rough, I'll need extra insurance.
My hands are shaking? It's totally normal, and proof I gave it a hundred percent... Hey! I said it's normal, alright!
No need for a blind chase. They won't get far, we should rest and refuel.
Stay cool, everyone. Fall back this way!
Big place. Wonder how the food tastes.
Careful now, you might prick your fingers.
Fruit's half off today, you can even buy it with points—ssh! Go get yours quick, and don't tell anyone.
Arknights.

I used to only see so many lanterns and decorations in Sauin parades. They don't carry the same significance, but it's breathtaking all the same. Go down for a closer look? Nah, here's a good spot. New Year's sale's starting soon, and I gotta be first in line.
Doctor, how was your break? Me, I'm still a little tired...

You're a real mystery, you know? I asked around and nobody seemed to know what you like for your birthday. But from what I've seen, you probably won't hate this. Try it out, nothing like hot soup to wash away all your worries, so chug it down and celebrate!

Doctor, I've archived these reports as you requested. I even have a closing speech for you while you wipe my access clearances. The info you were most interested in last year was— I can stop? But you told me yesterday we have to keep looking back to stay on the right track.

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to a Trading Post, the chance of getting <@cc.kw>higher-yield Precious Metal orders</> is <@cc.kw>increased slightly</> (rate is influenced by length of work time), and Morale consumed per hour is reduced by <@cc.vup>-0.25</>
When this Operator is assigned to a Trading Post, order acquisition efficiency <@cc.vup>+15%</>, +<@cc.vup>5%</> per Reception Room level, up to a maximum of <@cc.vup>30%</>
